text:
Hi welcome to How To Cook That I am Ann Reardon
and this is my channel you can explore the

videos below we've got macarons we got cake
decorating tutorials we've got chocolate,

heaps of chocolate and dessert recipes everything
sweet you'll find it here an I just wanted

to share with you a little bit of my story,
enjoy.

I was born in Australia and my mum and dad
are from England and I have an older sister

For some reason me and my sister were'nt allowed
to do many activities out of school so I took

to riding my bike and going for long runs
through the bush near where we lived.

One day I nearly trod on a dugite, but that's
another story.

We were'nt allowed many lollies unless it
was a birthday so to satisfy my sweet tooth
i loved to make cookies and cakes and desserts.

After I finished school I went to uni and
studied nutrition and food science and then

did a post grad in dietetics to become a dietitian
and helped people with medical reasons for
needing special diets.

After a few years of doing that I resigned
and started working with the young people

at my church which was in a rough area of
Western Australia, I remember one night having

a guy threaten me with a smashed bottle but
on the whole it was great fun and the youth
grew up to become fine young adults.

Some of them asked if I could teach them how
to cook so they came over and we baked together
and had a great time.

After writing out many of my recipes heaps
of times I decided that one day I'd start
a cooking blog.

Me and my hubby had our first son and a couple
of years later we had another little boy,

and at their first thier birthdays their cakes
were quite simple but as they got older they

started requesting what they wanted like star
wars AT AT cakes and minion cakes and drill
cakes.

And I learnt the basics of cake decorating
from books from the library.
That's right YouTube didn't exist then.

Around the same time my hubby started running
Youth Alive which is a state wide organisation

looking after youth leaders and youth groups
and running big events.

The budget was really tight so we did a lot
of entertaining in our home and I had the

pleasure of catering for those things which
is where I got lots of practice baking and
making desserts.

Later moved to Sydney and I became pregnat
with our third son.

While I was pregnat I developed an incredibly
rare allergy to sunlight which means I can't

go out in the sun for more than a few minutes
without being covered up in UV protective

clothing which gets really hot, so staying
indoors is a better option for me.

Our third son was born and he was quite unwell
and he had to have surgery at 4 weeks of age
and because of that he was really underweight.

He was less than birthweight at four weeks
so he needed feeding 3 hourly night and day

until he was 7 months old when he caught up
on his weight.

To keep myself awake during that time I started
the cooking blog while I was feeding at night.

So I learnt to type really well with one hand
with my laptop while I was feeding.

I wrote out my recipes that people asked for
the most often.

Which were of course desserts and sweet things
and baking.

The blog took off and I filmed a few tutorials
and found that people really liked to watch

how to cook that rather than just reading
about it.
So I started uploading to youtube once a week.

I was really surprised when it hit 1,000,000
video views each month and lots of people

were clicking like and subscribing to the
channel.

I read all of the comments that you guys make
and answer as many as I can and upload a new

video each week and put the recipe on the
blog for you howtocookthat.net

So if you have a sweet tooth like me make
sure you subscribe to do that you can click

here, here, here, here, here, here or if you
are watching on your mobile you can click

in the link in the description below this
video.
I'll see you all next week.
Bye
